name: places/ChIJRYIXW_dYwokRGhKrscgLnm0
formattedAddress: 119 W 57th St #1406, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 119 W 57th St #1406, New York, NY 10019-2400, USA

originalText.text:
The reviews didn't lie.

Ron is incredibly skilled and far too humble. I brought him a navy wool coat with a particularly nasty moth hole on the front of the sleeve - the damage was about 1.5-2cm in diameter.  He assessed the damage, and informed me he would call me back with a price after taking a closer look at it.

It wasn't cheap, and Ron had advised me to reconsider due to the cost. Still, repairing it was the cheaper and more sustainable choice than replacing it.

The work was impressive. Before he did the work he told me, it would look good enough that you would have to look real close to see there was ever a hole. It's better than that. You would need a magnifying glass to see it, if at all.

The work was impressive. Before he did the work he told me, it would look good enough that you would have to look real close to see there was ever a hole. It's better than that. You would need a magnifying glass to see it, if at all.

originalText.text:
I have a green donegal sweater I purchased on my first trip to Ireland that has a lot of sentimental value to me. Somehow, it developed a hole in the very front, I think from snagging on a shirt button. I was afraid of any repair being very noticeable.

I found French American from searching Google and its rave reviews. I called them and was told to mail them the sweater which I did. I few days later, I got a very reasonable price and mailed them a check. A few days later I got another call saying the sweater was repaired and was being shipped back to me.

I received the sweater today and there was a thread through where the repair was done. When held up to the light when looking at the back, you can see it was re-weaved. From the front, the repair was completely invisible. My wife and I were amazed.

I would highly recommend French American for sweater repairs.

originalText.text: Just wanted to THANK Ron for his honesty & sincerity in being up front with which of my jackets & pants were repairable (moth holes)with weaving & would  be up to his standard of excellence in being undetectable. I appreciate that very much. THANK YOU Ron.

text.text: Just wanted to THANK Ron for his honesty & sincerity in being up front with which of my jackets & pants were repairable (moth holes)with weaving & would  be up to his standard of excellence in being undetectable. I appreciate that very much. THANK YOU Ron.

originalText.text:
Ron’s re-weaving is MAGIC! Absolutely UNBELIEVABLE! It’s so silly to post the after photo, because you would never see that there was even a hole! Next time I will take before shots!!!

Ron is very honest, prices incredibly fair for this kind of labor, and his team is so talented at what they do. Like other reviews, he set expectations clearly in what he could and couldn’t do. Though I found his opinion of “75% quality repair” to be 150% at my standards. Truly above and beyond services here, and bound to become a routine stop for me.

I love my wardrobe, get a lot of wear from my pieces, and can’t stand to let anything go just for one or two small holes. Now I won’t ever have to!!!

originalText.text: A client had me send a piece of clothing to this company.  She was very pleased with their work and has sent additional pieces to them since.  It was hard to locate where they had made the repair because they did such a good job.
